jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description:
About Us

A career at Hitachi Rail will help create a legacy. With operations in every corner of the world, our work goes to the cutting-edge of digital transformation and technology. From the multi-cultural strength of our global organisation to the sustainable and innovative ways we work to bring people together, there's something for everyone to get stuck into. And that's where you come in.

The General Project Manager is the overall responsible for the Project and the Project results.
He/She manages a project relevant to a Communication and Control Systems of a Metro assuring the achievement of all and each objectives (technical, operationally, economical, Financially and business-wise) within the defined schedule and budget and with expected level quality and safety, leading and managing the execution and implementation of the projects vis-à-vis with the Customers(s) and in strict coordination with each "discipline" PM and the Company Functions.
He/she coordinates (and also... manages when necessary) also the various Hitachi Rail units involved in the project (Countries, BLs, other entities) in full respect of the Organization and policies assuring primarily the Hitachi Rail overall interest.
He/she coordinates (and also manages when necessary) also the other Consortium partners involved in the project in full respect of the Consortium agreement in place.
He/she is responsible for all qualifying points and competences for the management of a complex project (in a very multi culturally and multidisciplinary environment), using adequately and opportunely processes, methodologies, best practices, techniques and tools of Project Management.
He/she is responsible for the Direction and overall coordination of project team, which team is directed and managed efficiently in full alignment with the Company Organization.
Ultimately, he/she is responsible to proper direct and manage the Business associated to such a project.
He is Responsible for the satisfactory completion of Contract with particular reference to quality, HSE, timescale, cost, resources and Employer satisfaction for ensuring successful implementation of the project and project objectives.

His main responsibilities are as follows:
• Manage the project to achieve the targets, Customer satisfaction and Employer satisfaction and profitability
• Responsible for correct managing the Project, ensuring the predefined results on time and within budget and with expected level of Quality.
• Unique and sole interface towards the Client.
• Ensures full compliance with Safety Requirements and full implementation of the Safety Plan throughout the project in close cooperation with the Safety Manager.
• Define and develop the Customer relationship strategy: understand the client environment, determine the client's interfaces and identify client responsibilities.
• Identify all and each project stakeholder, understand their environment and their influences and/or expectation on the projects, and then define a plan for manage each of them in the project interest (according - wherever possible - to a win-win approach).
• Accountable for the project profitability, sales and costs.
• He/she plans and coordinates, interfacing with the team members and the company functions, activities and resources of the project for the fulfillment of the project objectives (milestones contract).
• He/she manages and ensures customer satisfaction (quality and time) and pursues continuous improvement.
• He/she manages the contractual terms of the project.
• He/she organizes and plans the project with appropriate management tools (i.e. Primavera).
• He/she supervises and controls the production / product integration of project-related systems, which includes the entire supply chain of the specific activities of the project and its products, interfacing with suppliers and engineering.
• He/she check the progress of the project activities, in reference to the planned timetable.
• He/she monthly monitor the profit of the project and identify and implement (and/or assure the implementation) of the necessary action plans to maximize the profit.
• He/she supervises and monitors and through - the assigned PMs - coordinates and the validation and verification of the system both in the factory and on-site, in order to get the customer validation, and commissioning of the plant.
• He/she supervises, coordinates and supports the System Engineer and Customer Service during the commissioning phases, maintenance and warranty. He/she is supported by the Project Design Authority who report at project level to GPM.
• Support the preparation and validate the project Statement of Work (baseline): confirm the scope, contractual issues and validate risk assumptions.
• Establishes the project structure including the project management organization and project team organization.
• Set-up the project team and assign project roles and responsibilities to individuals
• He primarily manages the assigned PMs which are leading and managing part of the projects assigned to the GPM.
• Establishes the project structure including the project management organization and project team organization.
• Establishes internal targets in line with Contract requirement and Hitachi Rail expectations.
• Establish and implement the Project Management Plan (PMP).
• Approves the general organization procedures (including the PQP) and all contractual procedures to be reviewed and approved by the Employer.
• Approves processes and general procedures (including progress measurement and performance measurements procedures)
• Implements the Project and mobilizes staff.
• Manages the project risks including contingency plans and risk mitigation.
• Assures correct application of Quality procedures.
• Assures correct and effective application of HSE procedures and instructions.
• Defines the project key progress and performance indicators (schedule, budget, quality).
• Manages with the Employer all the activities related to Variation to Contractual Scope of Work.
• Co-ordinates all Project activities.
• He/she ensures full adherence of assigned resources to corporate key-values, the Code of Ethics, Chorus and regulations of Health, Security, Safety, Environment (HSE).
• He/she represents the company and specifically the project in front of the customer assuring solutions purchased and the required results.
• He/she is focus in anticipation, especially in risks and opportunities management.
• He/she is oriented and focused on problem solving.
• He/she is oriented to the satisfaction of customer needs and ensuring the company's profitability.
• Closes-out the project.

Prerequisites and Skill
• University Degree on Engineering (Electronic, Telecommunication or informatics) or with equal knowledge matured during the professional experience.
• Experience of at least 10 years as PM or GPM
• Experience of at least 5 years in projects relevant to Communication and Control systems
• Good technical background of the solutions concerning the Communications system, Control systems, Security systems, Passenger information comfort system used in the Metro or Railways environment.
• Optimal knowledge of English language to daily works within foreign interlocutors and within international and multi-cultural contexts.
• Available to be located abroad for a medium/long term period (> 3 years)
• Available to Business Missions on worldwide basis.
• Strong competencies in organization and coordination of multiple and remote-located teams.
• Autonomy, entrepreneurs and proactivity attitude and behaviors. At the same time very rigorous and committed.
• Self-discipline and be-an-example is also required.
• Oriented to the Business and able to understand and Manage the Business (behind the Project itself)
• Strong motivation to work for targets
• High seniority and long experience to manage project with high complexity and a very difficult contexts, with challenging targets, within a multicultural and international environment facing multi-disciplinary technical aspects and areas.
• Adequate and proven competences to manage several kind of Customers and stakeholders again in a multi-cultural and international environment.

Thank you for your interest in Hitachi Rail. If your application is of interest, we will be in contact. Please do not hesitate to discover more about us and our latest jobs at https://www.hitachirail.com/careers .

At Hitachi Rail, there is a place for everyone. We welcome and value differences in background, age, gender, sexuality, family status, disability, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, and world view. It is our commitment to create an inclusive environment - we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We would be delighted if you would be one of our followers at https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail

jobs.title: Snr Manager / Director Process Development
jobs.description:
ASM is a leading global supplier of products, services, and materials for semiconductor processing. For more than half a century, innovation has been at the core of everything we do. Our smart, ambitious people are dedicated to creating cutting-edge solutions for the world’s leading semiconductor providers. Every day we push the development of next-generation computer-chip technology, always staying a few steps ahead of what’s next.

The talented, enthusiastic people at ASM are just like you: dedicated to improving people’s lives and unlocking new potential. With our collaborative approach to R&D, we advance key semiconductor technologies and platforms like ALD, epitaxy, PEALD, PECVD, and vertical furnaces. And we have recently entered the promising high-growth market: silicon carbide epitaxy. Year after year, our innovations help to make chips smaller, faster, and more powerful. In fact, you will find our technology in every aspect of modern life: in AI, medical equipment, 5G... smartphones, autonomous driving, and more.

Are you ready to lead the charge in SiC semiconductor technology development? We are on the lookout for an exceptional individual to step into the role of (Senior) Manager, Process Development. This is a unique leadership opportunity in defining the future of our Process Development Department. Your mission is to lead and empower a winning team of brilliant engineers and scientists, who are embarking on a thrilling journey of innovation and discovery. Your responsibilities will include:
• Forge New Frontiers: Develop groundbreaking thin film processes and applications in the areas of POWER DEVICES.
• Push Boundaries: Dive into semiconductor processing equipment to pioneer, research, and optimize processes, with a sharp focus on Epitaxial deposition of SiC and other emerging ultra wide band gap materials
• Elevate Excellence: Enhance and improve processes and reactor chambers of ASM products, setting new industry benchmarks.
• Building Excellence: Professionalize a world-class product development team comprising process engineers from diverse backgrounds, fostering a culture of innovation.
• Operational Excellence: Build up and professionalize software and hardware infrastructure to optimize process lab operations and data analysis.
• Showcase Mastery: Demonstrate state-of-the-art processes on SiC products to impress ASM customers and provide invaluable process data to our dynamic marketing team.
• Nurture Talent: Lead and cultivate a team of Process Engineers, empowering them to unleash their creativity, innovate, and develop intellectual property.
• Create Synergy: Collaborate closely with cross-functional ASM teams, including Product Marketing, HW Engineering, and Corporate R&D, to define and understand requirements, ensuring the successful execution of projects and demonstrations.
• Engineer Brilliance: Offer critical Process Engineering support to various arms of our organization, ensuring seamless operations.
• Create impact: Share your expertise by assisting in marketing, sales, and business development through presentations at customer engagements and international conferences.

Key criteria for success in this role:
• Education: A PhD or Master's degree in physics, chemistry, chemical engineering, or materials science, ideally with a thesis related to semiconductor or adjacent industries.
• Experience: 7+ years of hands-on experience leading R&D in SiC Epitaxial thin film deposition techniques, coupled with comprehensive metrology/characterization expertise.
• Connect the dots: A deep grasp of the intricate interplay between hardware, software, and process performance within a high-volume manufacturing environment.
• Problem-Solving: A proven track record in process development, experimental design, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, or reactor chamber design, with the ability to excel even under high-pressure situations.
• Knowledge of your surroundings: Understanding of fab facilities and utilities as well as their impact on process performance.
• Leadership Acumen: A minimum of 3 years of management experience, as well as a true passion for leading and growing fantastic teams
• Communication Mastery: Exceptional English communication skills are required to collaborate effectively in our international environment.
• Hands-On Approach: A sleeves up mentality when troubleshooting equipment.
• DOE: Proficiency in using statistical methods for planning and analyzing experiments
• Results-Oriented Mindset: A passion for problem-solving and driving exceptional results with a hands-on approach

Offer

Are you ready to embark on this journey of SiC innovation, seize unparalleled opportunities, and redefine the future of semiconductor technology whilst living and working in the beautiful city of Catania? Apply now and become a driving force in the exciting world of ASM!

At ASM we are committed to supporting our people, enabling them to develop their talents and perform at their best. We actively promote an inclusive and diverse culture that fosters trust and transparency. Our people are our power, and we value the differences between everyone because it is what make us better as a team. By embracing a wide range of perspectives, we enable a culture of continuous exploration and adoption of new ideas. At every step, we know that it is our valued people who enable us to deliver excellent products and service to our clients – and to make a meaningful difference in society.

So join us on our journey and unleash the power of an open mind. Discover how you can be part of our exciting future and apply today! To learn more about ASM, find us at asm.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube

Italferr ha un ruolo strategico nel processo di modernizzazione e sviluppo della rete ferroviaria a livello nazionale e internazionale, ha una eccellenza riconosciuta a livello internazionale nelle tecnologie a supporto della progettazione e sviluppa le proprie attività attraverso un impegno costante sulla sostenibilità e sicurezza, dalla valutazione degli investimenti alla progettazione e alla sorveglianza ambientale dei cantieri nella realizzazione delle infrastrutture ferroviarie.

Ricerchiamo un project manager che abbia voglia di contribuire all'evoluzione delle infrastrutture del... Paese e, con esse, del Sistema della mobilità, capace di confrontarsi con tutte le sfide del Piano Industriale, attento ai risultati, alle persone e all'innovazione.

La figura ricercata avrà la responsabilità della realizzazione dei progetti, della programmazione operativa e gestione del team di commessa, della pianificazione e del monitoraggio e avanzamento progetti e appalti e della gestione dei contratti interfacciandosi con il Responsabile della Direzione Operativa, i principali referenti della Direzione Lavori e Progettazione e di tutti gli stakeholders esterni (Appaltatori, Enti, Amministrazioni e Soggetti Terzi coinvolti).

RESPONSABILITA' E ATTIVITA'
• è responsabile dei risultati operativi delle commesse assegnate a partire dalla progettazione fino alla realizzazione dei progetti assegnati nel rispetto di tempi, costi e qualità stabiliti;
• cura la programmazione, assegnazione e monitoraggio delle risorse funzionali sia del Team di Progettazione sia del Team di Direzione Lavori;
• pianifica, monitora e controlla le commesse assegnate attraverso la riprogrammazione e verifica dello stato di avanzamento fisico/contabile. In caso di scostamento rispetto agli obiettivi assegnati individua e attua tutte le azioni utili al superamento di eventuali criticità al fine di garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi target. Cura le attività di Risk Management delle commesse assegnate;
• è responsabile del corretto adempimento da parte dell'Appaltatore/GC/CG degli obblighi contrattuali, della gestione di varianti/modifiche, proroghe, sospensioni e contenzioso e autorizzazione dei subappalti;
• è responsabile della gestione del contratto con il Cliente per gli incarichi assegnati e supporta lo stesso nelle attività di Responsabile Unico del Procedimento anche nei rapporti con gli Enti, le Amministrazioni e i soggetti terzi interessati e coinvolti nelle varie fasi di avanzamento delle commesse;
• è il responsabile dei Lavori ai sensi del D. Lgs. 81/08 'Testo Unico sulla Sicurezza';
• è responsabile in materia di sicurezza e salute sul lavoro in qualità di Dirigente Delegato ai sensi del D.Lgs. 81/08 limitatamente alle aree di cantiere riservate al personale Italferr.

Requisiti richiesti
• Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria indirizzo Civile, Trasporti, Edile, Strutture o Geotecnica ed il possesso dell'abilitazione all'esercizio della professione di Ingegnere
• ai fini della selezione saranno valutate le candidature con una significativa esperienza di almeno 10 anni, in ruoli di responsabilità e coordinamento, maturata nel settore di Ingegneria Opere Civili /Gestione Commesse Investimenti, preferibilmente nel settore infrastrutture, ferroviario o nella gestione di appalti pubblici
• conoscenza in materia di: infrastruttura ferroviaria, normativa di lavori pubblici e di sicurezza, contrattualistica appalti lavori, processi autorizzativi, processi di progettazione e costruzione, project management e tecnologia delle costruzioni
• è gradita conoscenza di piattaforme digitali di collaborazione e software BIM, e il possesso di una certificazione PMI e/o esperienze di PM Agile
• ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
• ottime capacità di visione sistemica, decisionalità manageriale, pianificazione e organizzazione, orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi, negoziazione e capacità di gestione delle relazioni con clienti e stakeholders

Se sei in possesso dei requisiti richiesti candidati entro e non oltre il 9 giugno 2024.

Ti aspettiamo

jobs.title: Direttore Commerciale Italia
Destination Manager – comunitá locale
jobs.description:
In questa posizione, darai un contributo importante alla creazione dell'Alto Adige come località in cui vivere. Ciò comporta la coesistenza in armonia di residenti, ospiti e ospitanti. Verranno affrontati diversi temi, come la mobilità, l'atteggiamento verso il turismo e la mancanza di manodopera qualificata. Le tue responsabilità comprenderanno anche la cura per le destinazioni di Bressanone , Vipiteno e dintorni.

Il tuo compito sarà quello di definire l'area di interesse della comunità locale insieme ai principali stakeholder e di sostenere l'attuazione delle misure sviluppate all'interno e all'esterno di IDM. Inoltre, supporterai le organizzazioni turistiche nel loro percorso dalla gestione della destinazione alla gestione della comunità locali.
Questi sono i tuoi compiti:
• Coordinamento e gestione degli attori turistici e non turistici in merito al concetto di comunità locale.
• Coordinamento dell'implementazione delle misure adottate da IDM sul tema delle "comunità locali".
•... Pianificazione, preparazione e organizzazione di workshop sul tema delle "comunità locali" con i reparti / dipartimenti interessati all'interno di IDM.
• Creazione e coordinamento del gruppo di lavoro "Comunità locali" all'interno di IDM.
• Supporto strategico alle organizzazioni turistiche nello sviluppo del programma annuale, nella cooperazione con altre organizzazioni turistiche e nell'implementazione di temi rilevanti per l'Alto Adige.
• Partecipazione allo sviluppo strategico e operativo dell'area di destinazione, dell'organizzazione stessa e dei servizi offerti in generale, con particolare attenzione all'intera gamma di modalità, al coinvolgimento degli stakeholder e ai modelli di governance.
Questi sono i requisiti per la posizione:
• Diversi anni di esperienza professionale, preferibilmente nel settore del turismo o del destination management o della gestione degli spazi abitativi.
• Conoscenza generale del paesaggio turistico altoatesino e dei suoi attori.
• Professionalità e piacere nel relazionarsi con le persone.
• Buone capacità di comunicazione e di presentazione.
• Disponibilità a lavorare in modo proattivo, strutturato e indipendente.
• Capacità di gestione di progetti.
• Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Office (in particolare Microsoft Excel e PowerPoint).
• Ottime competenze linguistiche in tedesco e italiano.
Quali sono i requisiti preferenziali per la posizione:
• Laurea, preferibilmente in gestione del turismo, sostenibilità, gestione regionale e destinazioni sostenibili, economia o simili.
• conoscenza diretta o indiretta del settore turistico e delle condizioni locali
• Esperienza nel coordinamento e nella gestione di persone
• Orientamento alla soluzione e al pensiero strategico
• Esperienza nella moderazione di workshop
Cosa offriamo
• Una missione chiara: contribuire alla trasformazione digitale dell'Alto Adige
• Un team dinamico ed appassionato;
• Programma di formazione individuale;
• Orario di lavoro: tempo pieno (40 ore) o part-time;
• Gestione flessibile dell’orario lavorativo;
• Possibilità di smart working fino a due volte a settimana;
• Tipo di contratto: rapporto di lavoro impiegatizio secondo il CCNL del terziario, della distribuzione e dei servizi;
• Sede di lavoro: Bolzano o una delle sedi IDM

Su di noi

IDM è impulso e forza motrice per lo sviluppo economico sostenibile dell’Alto Adige.

In IDM forniamo servizi con l’obiettivo di favorire uno sviluppo sostenibile dell’economia locale e aumentare di conseguenza la competitività delle aziende altoatesine. Supportiamo l’internazionalizzazione e l’innovazione specialmente delle piccole e medie imprese (PMI) e sosteniamo i filmmaker nella realizzazione di progetti cinematografici.

Con il marketing del turismo rafforziamo invece l’Alto Adige come marchio e con il marketing agroalimentare promuoviamo i prodotti di qualità

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description:
Ensuring VRV - Chart’s Success…

VRV, part of Chart Industries Inc., is an important industrial reality present for more than 60 years in the international arena both in the design and production of pressure equipment for the Oil & Gas sectors, and in the engineering and manufacture of insulation tanks for the distribution and storage of gas in the Cryogenic sector, as well as a company operating in the Automotive HNLG business.

We are looking for a Project Manager to join our Project Management Team in order to ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget. The candidate will guarantee the client firm satisfaction and an excellent relationship management with it, beyond the start up of the project.

What Your Day-to-Day Activities Will Be…
• Ensure that assigned projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
• Manage within the ERP production materials request related to the project
• Budget transfer from sponsor and creating pre-kick... and kick off activities through company
• Interface role with main internal stakeholder to creating time schedule, risk plan, confirmation of PO, as well as following project milestones
• Monitoring and managing changes required by the customer
• Monitoring the fulfilling of deadlines, notifying possible delays
• Develop a detailed project plan to track progress and adapt work as required
• Coordination of cooperation of individual departments working on the project, as well as coordinating staff and internal resources.
• Cost monitoring and Designing risk mitigation plan
• Communication with customers about all facts related to the project, managing relationships with clients and stakeholders
• Coordination of customer inspection visits.
• Issuing shipping and invoicing instructions.
• Coordination of and closing of project punch list before transfer to service department
• Elaboration of regular reports on the status of projects possible sending on business trips.
• Maintain a comprehensive project documentation and project reporting, overseeing all incoming and outgoing project documentation.
• Carrying out other activities corresponding to the type of work agreed in the employment contract

Requirements & Preferred Qualifications will be…
• Bachelor or Master’s degree in Engineering field
• Communicative knowledge of English and others; Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English are a must
• At least 2 years of experience in Project Management
• User knowledge of working on a PC
• User knowledge in MRP systems, SAP is advantage
• Analytical thinking
• Management skills
• Team orientation
• Good organizational and presentation skills
• Flexibility, independence, Conflict resolution skills
• Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
• Ability to make decisions, Big-picture thinking and vision
• Communicativeness, the art of acting and communicating with customers
• The art of resolving conflict situations
• The art of coordinating activities
• Appropriate conduct in business
